Job Description
Verification Intern
Description:
Design and write STD with understanding testing methodology.
Analyze and debug failures and issue founded reports.
Customer documentation verification.
Integrated work with development teams.
Determining priority for test scenario and creating execution plans for implementation.

Advantage and Qualification:
Experience in SW & System testing.
Experience in writing test plans and challenge the development and system teams.
Team player who has excellent interpersonal skills.
Fast learner and looking to be exposed and work with new technologies.
Highly dedicated and motivated engineer.
ISTQB is an advantage.
Test tools and framework ALM & Jira.
Inclusion and Diversity
GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.
Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.
Additional Information
The job is open to men and women equally
Relocation Assistance Provided: NoShow more Report

Job Description :
Diageo is a global leader in beverage alcohol with an outstanding collection of over 200 brands - old and new, large, and small, global and local – that are enjoyed in more than 180 countries around the world! Brands like Crown Royal, Ciroc, Johnnie Walker, Guinness, Tanqueray, Captain Morgan, Baileys, Smirnoff, Bulleit, Ketel One and Don Julio are at the very heart of what we do. Global or local, every one of our brands has a story - all have a unique purpose and role to play in creating enduring connections with people.
Our performance ambition is to be one of the best performing, most trusted and respected consumer products companies in the world. We are proud of the brands we make and the enjoyment they give to millions. We are passionate about alcohol playing a positive role in society as part of a balanced lifestyle. This, as well as celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture, is core to our purpose of “celebrating life, every day, everywhere”!
YOUR ROLE
As a 2023 summer intern, you will get first-hand experience with our work, our people, our values, and our culture. Interns are given real responsibilities and challenges with projects that have an immediate impact on the business. Throughout the summer, you are given multiple opportunities to interact with senior management through both their project work as well as informative and cultural events. All interns receive individual mentoring and training from their immediate manager, and the opportunity to show results. You are expected to perform to our high standards and are given the same kind of performance feedback we give our full-time employees.
During the 10-week summer internship, you will be asked to immerse yourself in one of our key organizational business units and develop a business plan proposal that will get us a step closer in achieving our ambition.
Sample Marketing Projects from past internships
Develop an in-depth understanding of the Guinness Extra Stout (GES) consumer and develop a marketing plan to enhance the volume opportunity for GES
Deliver a relationship marketing strategy for the Tanqueray portfolio.
Develop a revitalization plan for the iconic Seagram’s 7.
Build a strategy to double the volume of Smirnoff Ice in five years.
Leverage sports and the multiverse to drive Captain Morgan growth to multicultural audiences
Key Qualifications
Currently enrolled in an MBA program
Marketing MBA interns typically have 2 to 5 years of work experience
Leadership, with a particular focus on transformational and inspirational problem solvers
Creativity
Critical thinking
Ability to work autonomously
Data analysis, synthesis, and interpretation
Strong communication and presentation skills
Relationship building
Salary Range:
Minimum Salary:
$50.00/hour
Maximum Salary:
$50.00/hour
At Diageo certain roles are eligible for additional rewards, including annual incentive payment and stock awards. US based employees are eligible for healthcare benefits, retirement benefits, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellness benefits and industry leading parental leave, among others. (Benefits/perks listed may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Diageo and the country where you work.) The salary range displayed is the salary range for the roles primary location.
Worker Type :
Internship (Fixed Term)
Primary Location:
3WTC
Additional Locations :
Job Posting Start Date :

Job Description :
Diageo is a global leader in beverage alcohol with an outstanding collection of over 200 brands - old and new, large, and small, global and local – that are enjoyed in more than 180 countries around the world! Brands like Crown Royal, Ciroc, Johnnie Walker, Guinness, Tanqueray, Captain Morgan, Baileys, Smirnoff, Bulleit, Ketel One and Don Julio are at the very heart of what we do. Global or local, every one of our brands has a story - all have a unique purpose and role to play in creating enduring connections with people.
Our performance ambition is to be one of the best performing, most trusted and respected consumer products companies in the world. We are proud of the brands we make and the enjoyment they give to millions. We are passionate about alcohol playing a positive role in society as part of a balanced lifestyle. This, as well as celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture, is core to our purpose of “celebrating life, every day, everywhere”!
YOUR ROLE
As a 2023 summer intern, you will get first-hand experience with our work, people, values, and culture. Summer interns are given responsibilities and challenges with projects that have an immediate impact on the business. Throughout the summer, you are given multiple opportunities to engage with senior management through both project work, as well as informative and cultural events. All interns receive individual coaching and training from their immediate manager and program buddy. You are encouraged to perform to our high standards and are given the same kind of performance feedback we give our full-time employees.
During the 10-week summer internship, you will be immersed in one of our key organizational business units and develop a business plan proposal that will get us a step closer in achieving our ambition.
Sample Finance Projects from past internships
Develop pricing strategies and consumer insights to promote growth within tequila and convenience brands
Build competitive benchmarking template to drive understanding of competitive landscape for luxury and reserve brands
Identify P&L impacts on Diageo Beer Company to forecast category trends and future commercial impacts
Provide transparency into financial impact of cost components, structures, and drivers across North American market to drive cost savings
Key Qualifications
Currently enrolled in an MBA program
Finance MBA interns typically have 2 to 5 years of work experience
Self-starter; ability to work independently and own summer project
Problem solving and critical thinking skills
Shown analytical / financial modeling skills
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Highly ambitious, geographically mobile, and high level of business maturity
Proven high analytical capabilities and insight generation, emerging high potential future leader
Salary Range:
Minimum Salary:
$50.00/hour
Maximum Salary:
$50.00/hour
At Diageo certain roles are eligible for additional rewards, including annual incentive payment and stock awards. US based employees are eligible for healthcare benefits, retirement benefits, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellness benefits and industry leading parental leave, among others. (Benefits/perks listed may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Diageo and the country where you work.) The salary range displayed is the salary range for the roles primary location.

Finaro is a global cross-border payment and banking solutions provider empowering international commerce through brilliantly simple payments.
Our passionate team, exceptional tech capabilities, product innovation, and customer-centric approach drive us to simplify complexity and create multidimensional solutions that generate growth and give our customers peace of mind. At Finaro we manage critical internet-scale finance transaction services. Stability is a core value, and the BizOps analyst’s main responsibility is to deliver information-based analytics to achieve stability.
As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a BizOps Analyst student (60%).
In this role, you will operate Finaro’s core systems, analyze data lakes, build new monitoring methods and deliver better visibility and stability to Finaro’s information services.
Responsibilities:
Develop methods with IT and business units to support the information system’s stability.
Monitor business applications’ health using a variety of technologies.
Become an application expert and support business issues and bugs around it
Build Kibana (ELK) base dashboards and SQL-based reports.
Analyze systems malfunctions in real-time using multiple analyzing and Big data tools.
Produce Root Cause Analysis post incidents and manage the process of proper fixes and future mitigation.
Manage real-time incidents, communicate with IT operators, Business users, and management, act as a focal point and lead the incident to proper resolution in the most responsible manner.
Requirements:

Analyst - Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amounts of information with accuracy.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to details
SQL - mandatory. Firm knowledge in SQL coding.
Kibana – knowledge in Kibana analysis, create reports/dashboards - advantage
Resilient – be able to sustain critical incidents.
Possess excellent organizational and interpersonal communication skills.
Working in a Production environment – a strong advantage
B.Sc. in Industrial Engineering/math/information system or other quantitative fieldsShow more Report

At Nym, we’re passionate about simplifying healthcare by automating the accurate interpretation of clinical language.
Our interdisciplinary team has developed an innovative technology that can understand clinical language and provides an entirely new way of analyzing and decoding medical records into clear, concise, and actionable information. This ultimately ensures clinical and administrative teams can spend more time focused on patient care.
At Nym, the future is bright. Our engine currently processes over five million charts annually in more than 150 emergency department and urgent care settings across the US. We are backed by top-tier VCs and growing rapidly, with offices in NYC and Tel Aviv.
Come join us!
Role and Responsibilities:
Nym is looking for a Medical Data Analyst to join our growing Implementation group, reporting to our Squad Lead. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new clients and analyzing both historical and real-time client data while supporting the on-going configuration of Nym’s CLU engine according to the client’s needs and specifications.
As a Medical Data Analyst, you will:
Analyze and understand clients’ business objectives and needs while customizing Nym’s CLU engine accordingly.
Ensure the successful integration of Nym’s products for the client.
Support Nym’s clients throughout the technical integration process, including identifying bugs and recommending fixes and improvements.
Work with our multidisciplinary R&D team (Software Engineers, Linguists and Medical Doctors, Product team, and Customer Success team.
Provide technical solutions for alerts and incoming escalated tickets from our customers, including extensive troubleshooting and root cause assessment.
Find workarounds and solutions for technical challenges – doing whatever it takes for the customer to get the best service out of our product.
Perform configuration changes, deployments, and product expansions for our customers.
Develop automation tools and scripts to make your work more efficient.
Requirements:

Hands-on SQL or Pandas skills.
Familiarity with medical terminology.
Ability to work as part of a team in a fast-growing start-up.
High performer in challenging situations.
Fluent in English – both written and spoken.
Python knowledge and experience- Strong advantage.Show more Report

Description

Deloitte is looking for an Information Systems Analyst to join our growing team.

Characterization of customer needs
Building solutions
Building work processes
User support
Acceptance testing
Operation monitoring management
Status and Integration meetings
Discussion summaries
Task tracking
Requirements
Industry & Management /Information Systems graduates
1-2 Years of experience as Information systems analyst or in a similar role
Background and experience in the field of health- Advantage
good communication skills while interfacing with clients and managers
Multitasking and self-management skills

Full time Job

Location: Sheba Hospital, Ramat Gan/Airport City

We at Deloitte believe that diversity and inclusion among our people is a critical component of our success and that is why we cultivate an organizational culture that contains and embraces diversity in all its forms.Show more Report

Location: Sapir Street 6, Herzliya, Israel
Are you brilliant?
Finaro is reimagining the payment industry.
If you value friendship, learning, and getting things done; if you consider yourself creative, enthusiastic and passionate about solving problems – We want to meet you!
Finaro is a global cross-border payment and banking solutions provider empowering international commerce through brilliantly simple payments
Our passionate team, exceptional tech capabilities, product innovation, and customer-centric approach drive us to simplify complexity and create multidimensional solutions that generate growth and give our customers peace of mind.
We work with some of the biggest industry giants including Plus500, WOLT, Kiwi.com, Air Baltic, Payrexx, Revolut, Go2Mobile and Hero Gaming. With a growing global staff of 350 employees, main offices in Israel and Malta, and presence all across Europe, in China, Hong Kong, and North America, the future looks fantastic.
The future looks Finaro.

Job Description
Responsibilities
Work with complex data to draw actionable insights
Design and create automatic reports, triggers, dashboards to promote data-driven decision making across the company.
Generate data analysis reports and translate them to the required business functions - Customer success, product or marketing
Work with the team to determine KPI's, budget allocation and overall processes health.
Work with our client's campaigns and creating actionable advice for our clients to use the platform.
Someone to bring insights and suggestions to stakeholders and customers by conducting deep analysis and research
‍
Requirements
1+ years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst
Highly proficient in SQL – a must
Experience working with reporting tools (Tableau/QlikView/PowerBi/Sisense) - a must
Experience with experimental design (A/B tests) and statistical data analysis
Ability to turn large amounts of ambiguous data into a concise, meaningful story
Scripting Language: Python/R/PHP – an advantage
BSc/BA in a quantitative field - advantage
Working with product team - advantage
Working with a business CS team - advantage
Working previously with SaaS product - advantage
‍
Email: jobs@smsedge.com

Video - smsedge.com/video
